Client * instance ()

Detailed Description

Client database interface.

All interactions with client information take place here; the database backend is encapsulated in this class, and can be changed without change to the API.

Member Function Documentation

Client * Client::instance (   )  [static]
 

Returns the single instance of this class.

If the instance doesn't exist, this function creates it. The instance should not yet exist only when called from main.cpp.

void Client::destroy (   ) 
 

Destroys the single instance.

This should only occur in main.cpp

Performs all constructor operations.

This is not done in the constructor because circular requests for instance pointers results

Create a client.

The caller must provide the new client name and year-end closing month.

void Client::open (  QString  id  ) 
 

Open a client.

The id is obtainable from Client::defaultClientId() or Client::getAllClients().

Check if a client is open.

void Client::close (   ) 
 

Close the client.

No id is necessary since only one client is open at a time.

void Client::setClientName (  QString  newClientName  ) 
 

Sets the client's name.

Changes the client's name in the database, and emits a clientNameChanged(QString) signal.

QString Client::getClientName (   )  const
 

Gets the client's name.

QStringList Client::getAllClients (   )  const
 

Returns a list of all clients in the clientPath.

An element from this list is suitable as an id for Client::open(id)

QString Client::defaultClientId (   )  const
 

Returns the id of the default client.

bool Client::defaultClientExists (   )  const
 

Returns 'true' if the default client exists.

The default client may not exist if the clientPath was changed outside of the program or the file or database was removed manually. This function will need to be rewritten if one changes the backend database.

QString Client::getPeriodBegin (   )  const
 

Get the first month, day, & year of the period.

QString Client::getPeriodEnd (   )  const
 

Get the last month, day, & year of the period.

void Client::clientOpened (  QString   )  [signal]
 

A client was opened.

The QString contains the client's name

void Client::clientClosed (  QString   )  [signal]
 

The client was closed.

The QString contains the client's name

void Client::clientNameChanged (  QString   )  [signal]
 

The client's name was changed.

The QString contains the client's new name
